item.title: Flood alert: Upper Bristol Avon area
item.description: River levels are rising further at the Fosseway and Great Somerford gauges. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge. Further rain is forecast Saturday and Sunday. River levels are expected to rise further in response to this rain. We are closely monitoring the situation . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 25 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

item.title: Flood alert: River Churn and its tributaries
item.description:
River levels are high on parts of the River Churn. Therefore flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible today, especially near Cerney Wick. Rain is expected later today (24.01.26) and then will continue though most of the evening. The rain is expected to be mostly light, but levels may respond to the rainfall.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Avoid low lying footpaths and roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.
This message will be updated by 12:00 pm on 25 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

item.title: Flood alert: River Windrush from Bourton to Newbridge
item.description:
River levels are high on parts of the River Windrush. Therefore flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, especially in the Newbridge area. Rain is expected later today (24.01.26) and will continue though most of the evening. The rain is expected to be mostly light, but levels may respond to the rainfall.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Avoid low lying footpaths and roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.
This message will be updated by 12:00 pm on 25 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

item.title: Flood alert: River Evenlode from Moreton in Marsh to Cassington and also the River Glyme at Wootton and Woodstock
item.description:
River levels remain high on parts of the River Evenlode and Glyme. Therefore flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible today, especially in the Woodstock area. Rain is expected later today (24.01.26) and will continue though most of the evening. The rain is expected to be mostly light, but levels may respond to the rainfall.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Avoid low lying footpaths and roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.
This message will be updated by 12:00 pm on 25 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

item.title: Flood alert: River Thames and its small tributaries from Calcutt to Lechlade
item.description:
River levels remain high on the River Thames. Therefore flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible today, especially near Hannington Bridge. Rain is expected later today (24.01.26) and will continue though most of the evening. The rain is expected to be mostly light, but levels, currently falling, may respond to the rainfall.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Avoid low lying footpaths and roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.
This message will be updated by 12:00 pm on 25 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

item.title: Flood alert: River Dikler from Condicote to Little Rissington
item.description:
River levels are high on parts of the River Dikler. Therefore flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible today, especially in areas of Bourton on the Water close to the River Dikler. Rain is expected later today (24.01.26) and will continue though most of the evening. The rain is expected to be mostly light, but levels, which are currently falling, may respond to the rainfall.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Avoid low lying footpaths and roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.
This message will be updated by 12:00 pm on 25 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

item.title: Warning no longer in force: Tributaries on the Upper River Thames above Cricklade
item.description: There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected. We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

item.title: Flood alert: River Severn in Gloucestershire
item.description: High river levels today may lead to flooding today 24 January 2026. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Severn from Tewkesbury to Gloucester. Locations that may be affected include Apperley, Maisemore, Hempstead, Minsterworth Ham and Quedgley. Severn Ham, Tewkesbury may fill. Predicted peaks:- Mythe 3.5m to 3.8m on Monday 26 January 2026. We are closely monitoring the situation . Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 25 January 2026 or as the situation changes

item.title: Flood alert: River Leadon catchment
item.description: River levels remain high today 24 January 2026. Flooding is possible. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 25 January 2026 or as the situation changes

item.title: Flood alert: River Avon in Worcestershire
item.description: High river levels today may lead to flooding today 24 January 2026 . Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Avon from Abbotts Salford to Tewkesbury. Other locations that may be affected include Offenham, Evesham, Twyning and the Eckington Road. Mill Bank Road from Jubillee Bridge to Fladbury is impacted. Predicted peaks: Bredon 2.2m to 2.4m on Monday 26 January 2026. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 25 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

item.title: Flood alert: River Thames and tributaries from Buscot Wick down to Kings Lock
item.description:
River levels remain high on the River Thames. Therefore flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible today near the river between Buscot Lock and Eynsham Lock. Rain is expected later today (24.01.26) and will continue though most of the evening. The rain is expected to be mostly light.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Avoid low lying footpaths and roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.
This message will be updated by 12:00 pm on 25 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

item.title: Flood alert: River Wye in Herefordshire
item.description: High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 24 January 2026 . High river levels today may lead to continued flooding. Flooding is possible on 24th January 2026. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads along the River Wye from Hay on Wye to Ross on Wye. Other locations affected may include the A438 between Letton & Willersey, Byford, Bredwardine & Hereford. Road closures & diversions on the A438 may be in force. Predicted peaks:- Hay On Wye 1.8 to 2.2 25/01 AM, Bredwardine 3.6 to 4.1 25/01 AM, Belmont 3.7 to 4.2 25/01 PM, Old Wye Bridge 3.2 to 3.7 25/01 PM, Mordiford 3.5m to 4.0m 25/01 PM, Ross on Wye 3.2m to 3.7m 25/01 PM, We are closely monitoring We are closely monitoring the situation . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 25 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

item.title: Flood alert: River Wye in Gloucestershire
item.description: High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 24 January 2026 . High river levels today may lead to continued flooding. Flooding is possible on 24th January 2026. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads along the River Wye. Predicted peaks:- Ross on Wye 3.2m to 3.7m 25/01 PM Lydbrook 3.5m to 4.0m 26/01 AM We are closely monitoring the situation . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 25 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

item.title: Flood alert: River Severn in Worcestershire
item.description: High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 24 January 2026 and for the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land & roads adjacent to the river from Highley to Tewkesbury; including Dog Lane Bewdley, Stourport, Diglis & Hylton Road towpath. Flooded drains affect the racecourse & Worcester CCG. PLP should be installed. New St Gate closed at Upton upon Severn. Predicted peaks:- Worcester 3.5m to 3.7m on Sunday 25/01PM, Diglis 3.4m to 3.7m on Sunday 25/01PM, Kempsey Yacht Club 5.5m to 6.0m on Sunday 25/01PM, Saxons Lode 4.0m to 4.5m on Sunday 25/01PM, We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on Sunday 25 January 2026 or as the situation changes.
